snippet: Alphabet Inc's Google on Tuesday announced a new "Pixel" smartphone and a suite of new consumer electronics products for the home, planting itself firmly in the hardware business and challenging Apple Inc's  iPhone at the high end of the $400 bill...

snippet: Companies like Amazon and Microsoft are building data centers across the Continent in response to Europeansâ€™ desires to keep their information close to home.
abstract: Amazon, Google and Microsoft are expanding number of data centers in Europe to satisfy European Union privacy laws and protect information stored on servers there from requests by foreign governments; companies are also motivated by profit due to growing demand for cloud computing services in Europe, expected to reach $16.1 billion by end of decade.

headline.main: U.S. Tech Giants Are Investing Billions to Keep Data in Europe
headline.print_headline: U.S. Tech Giants Investing to Keep Data in Europe

snippet: PepsiCo Inc has been accused in a lawsuit of misleading shoppers into believing its Naked juices and smoothies primarily contain "high-value" ingredients such as kale, when the main ingredient is often cheaper, less nutritious apple juice.

snippet: Detroit resident Ron Shelton knows it's a gamble to sink his scant finances that include earnings from carpentry work into a small apple orchard and cider mill in a neighborhood with vacant land and aging homes.
